name: Whistles and Canaries
description: Is a utopian past for humanity worth saving if it led to a horrific future? Andorians Shran and Jhamel believe the Romulans' beneficial influence will come at a terrible price--and may have insider proof.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Shran, Jhamel, Jarok, Humanoid Figure, or Enterprise crew will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Shran, Jhamel, Jarok, Humanoid Figure, or Enterprise crew
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

adventures.name: Hear No Evil
adventures.description: Sweep the meeting location for listening devices.

adventures.name: Without a Trace
adventures.description: Plan staggered departures to avoid attention.

adventures.name: Speak No Evil
adventures.description: Confiscate all communications devices before the meeting.

goals.flavor: Keep the focus on humanity with Section 31.
Sneak around and sabotage with the Maquis.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "A new version of human history where you share it with the Romulans. All your species' accomplishments overshadowed by falcons and wolves."

"If that isn't enough to get your blood up, then consider that as perfected as this new version of humanity might be, even in their own history, the Romulans have never done anything that hasn't benefited them in some way."

"I've seen first hand the cruelty Romulans can inflict. I hope very much we are wrong, but we owe it to your species to be sure. We have a Romulan contact who may have information, if we can provide him with a safe meeting."
"Our new place in Earth's history wasn't by design. Some quirk of fate--which, it seems controls our lives these days--brought this about."

responses.text: "And this would be a bad thing? What would the Romulans do?"
"But this is just one alternate history among thousands, isn't it?"
"I knew it. Romulans are schemers and betrayers, all."

screens.text: "But my people have a knack for turning an accident to their advantage. And so they plan to do, with their new place in human and Federation history. Remember, this would now make them one of the founders--and grant them all the power and influence that goes with it."

"What does alternate mean when all timelines and all universes have converged like this? We live in all of them simultaneously, in a way. To bring this to pass in one timeline now means they have access to its benefits and drawbacks in this one, too."
"Sometimes to your benefit, I hope you'll remember. I'll be dodging Tal Shiar agents for the rest of my days."

"These are Romulans of our timeline, with all their prejudices and admonitions and warmongering impulses, plotting what to do with access to a universe where humanity developed in lockstep with them, and they founded the Federation. What wouldn't they do?"

"We must have proof, specific plans. I have reason to fear the Romulans... but their positive influence on humanity in this alternate timeline proves they are capable of both great and terrible things."
